meanings.definition: To act as a stooge or accomplice.
meanings.sent1: He was stooging for his friend during the magic show.
meanings.sent2: She was caught stooging for the prankster at school.
meanings.sent3: The cat was stooging for the mouse, pretending not to notice its presence.
meanings.sent4: The spy was stooging for the enemy, feeding them false information.
meanings.sent5: The actor was stooging on stage, playing the role of the bumbling sidekick.

meanings.definition: The act of serving as a stooge or accomplice.
meanings.sent1: His stooging in the comedy act always got the biggest laughs.
meanings.sent2: The stooging of the group member helped them pull off the heist.
meanings.sent3: The monkey's stooging in the circus act delighted the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her stooging in the play added an element of surprise to the plot.
meanings.sent5: The clown's stooging at the party kept everyone entertained.
